reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at this excellent hotel for one night in April 2009. I wish we'd stayed longer. For the 50 euros we paid, we got a modern, clean, room, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, the most relaxing bathtub I have ever bathed, free internet, and the most charming, gracious and accomodating staff I've seen in quite some time. The hotel is quite old but was recently refurbished, apparently with a trip to IKEA, and is now decorated in cream and brown with orange and red accents. There is a lounge and bar area and the rooms are located upstairs. The bathtub is amazing - there is even a place to rest your elbows while you are reading!!!
reviews.title: Unbeatable value, Fanatstic bed and bathtub, perfect location, incredible staff

reviews.text: The hotel is located right by the Plaza Espolon, which is the town center, and by Calle Laurel, where all the tapas bars are located. It's a 7 euro cab ride or a 25 minute walk from the train station and a 20 minute walk from the bus station. For food, you can't go wrong with Calle Laurel/San Agustin area and for breakfast, check out the exquisite pastires at Cafe Viena in the Plaza Espolon.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All this would have easily qualified for 5 stars, but what really pushed this place over the top was the incredible staff - who were cheerful at all times of the day and night and went out of ther way to help you - directions, map, advice, etc. After I found out my train was full, they agreed to allow me to keep my bags there if I chose to return to the city after spending a night in another town - I didn't end up doing this, but the fact that they agreed to help me like that out was amazing. I'd return to Logrono again just to stay at this gem of a place.
reviews.title: Great modern hotel

reviews.text: I had terribel pain in my feet from the trek I had just done on the Camino and needed a bath to soak my feet in. I followed hotel signs around the streets and when I walked in front of this place, I could tell this was where I wanted to be. Entrance is cool, designer, and inviting. No fuss check-in led to room which was very "hotelish" (glasses all marked stterilised and 6 TV channels on old TV) but fine: clean, functional, and everything worked. Bathtub was not big so if you like a good bathtub ask for one in case they have one and couples should make sure bed is set up as a double as my was two singles but as I was alone this was OK. Copious brekfast and you are very well located for restuarants, bars, etc. there is an English newstand some 400 metres away that carries economist and Herald Tribune and teh main square and market nearby.
reviews.title: Likely the best breakfast on the Camino

likes.liked: — location, quality of facilities, helpful staff
